MajorClaims.Text: individuals should pay their college tuition
the individual should finance his or her education

Claims.Text: it would cost too much, the college education is a personal's choice, and there are many ways to fund a college education
it would cause too much cost from taxpayers and the governmen
making college education free would cost too much
those people should make the financial investment in their own choice; not the government
there are many ways to fund a college education

Premises.Text: it would affect all taxpayers whether or not they benefit from the use of the funds
It would divert public funds from other needs such as law enforcement, infrastructure and so forth
There are many other needs which should come first, such as providing health care to all American, or improving public schools
it would cause to raise our taxes again and again to fund college education
it is a personal choice to go to a college
Not everyone wants to go to a college
People who want to make more money, and live a better life than other people decide to take a college education
People who cannot afford to pay their tuition benefit from the scholarship, financial aids, and other funds
the government already helps pay college expense through indirect means
They often provide services such as fire departments, medical assistance, and police protection for the schools and their students
They also provide funds for academic research
While the money is not given to individual students, these contributions are not trivial
